Department of Justice

Family Violence Intervention Order

If you needed to place an intervention or you would need to fil in a form that was only recently made available online for download only.

But then, once you had completed the form, you would have to phsyically drop it off to the local Neighbourhood Justice Centre, regardless of where yu lived or your own sense of safety.

That form would then be manually entered into a system within the court or alternatively the police could fax it.

In 2013 we started to work hand in hand with the Neighbourhood Justice Centre to reinterpret the way in which the entire process and relationships between victims, the courts and the police related.

By taking the courts through our wide range of processes, we were able to map out the entire system within the courts and provide ways of making a very complicated system unified, user centred and effective.

Together with the Neighbourhood Justice Center, we took this single paper form and all of its processes and banished it back to the 20th century.
